comment:
* Safe identifier for a window.  This currently allows you to retrieve and observe
 * the input focus state of the window.  Most applications will
 * not use this, instead relying on the simpler (and more efficient) methods available
 * on {@link View}.  This classes is useful when window input interactions need to be
 * done across processes: the class itself is a Parcelable that can be passed to other
 * processes for them to interact with your window, and it provides a limited safe API
 * that doesn't allow the other process to negatively harm your window.

methods.name: public boolean isFocused()
methods.comment: * Retrieve the current focus state of the associated window.

methods.name: public void registerFocusObserver(FocusObserver observer)
methods.comment: * Start monitoring for changes in the focus state of the window.

methods.name: public void unregisterFocusObserver(FocusObserver observer)
methods.comment: * Stop monitoring changes in the focus state of the window.

methods.name: public boolean equals(@Nullable Object otherObj)
methods.comment:
* Comparison operator on two IntentSender objects, such that true
     * is returned then they both represent the same operation from the
     * same package.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel out, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel out, int flags)
